Generation IV.Diamond: It blooms during times of strong sunlight. It tries to make up for everything it endured as a bud.
Generation IV.Pearl: It is docile as a bud, but turns cheerful when it blooms. It folds back into a bud if sunlight wanes.
Generation IV.Platinum: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun's rays with its whole body.
Generation IV.HeartGold: During times of strong sunlight, its bud blooms, its petals open fully, and it becomes very active.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: During times of strong sunlight, its bud blooms, its petals open fully, and it becomes very active.

Generation V.Black: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun's rays with its whole body.
Generation V.White: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun's rays with its whole body.
Generation V.Black 2: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun's rays with its whole body.
Generation V.White 2: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun's rays with its whole body.

Generation VI.X: During times of strong sunlight, its bud blooms, its petals open fully, and it becomes very active.
Generation VI.Y: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun's rays with its whole body.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: During times of strong sunlight, its bud blooms, its petals open fully, and it becomes very active.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun's rays with its whole body.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It blooms during times of strong sunlight. The Pokémon tries to make up for everything it endured as a bud.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It is docile as a bud and turns cheerful when it blooms. It folds back into a bud if sunlight wanes.
Generation VIII.Sword: After absorbing plenty of sunlight, Cherrim takes this form. It's full of energy while it's like this, and its liveliness will go on until sundown.
Generation VIII.Shield: The faint scent that emanates from its full blossom entices bug Pokémon to it.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Cheerfully active on sunny days. Immediately closes its petals and becomes immobile once the sun becomes hidden, however.

Generation VIII.Sword: Bridge Field , Dappled Grove , Giant's Mirror , Stony Wilderness ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Shield: Bridge Field , Dappled Grove , Giant's Mirror , Stony Wilderness ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Obsidian Fieldlands : The Heartwood Shaking trees Crimson Mirelands : Gapejaw Bog Shaking trees Coronet Highlands : Lonely Spring , near Primeval Grotto , Bolderoll Ravine Shaking trees
